title: Top Packers WR Reed has clavicle, foot surgeries

title: Raleigh passes Mantle, ties Griffey with 55, 56

content: Shohei Ohtani threw five no-hit innings Tuesday night against an imposing Phillies lineup before exiting as a pitcher, only to watch the Dodgers' bullpen implode again in a 9-6 loss.

title: Panthers' Tkachuk expected to be out until Dec.

content: Katia Lindor minored in music at St. Mary's University in Texas and is a classically trained violinist.

content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: People’s cooperation vital to make Andhra Pradesh dump yard-free, says MA&UD Minister Narayana
content: Government working towards making roads clean, providing safe drinking water, and putting in place a good solid and liquid waste management in urban areas, he says

title: Archbishop Emeritus Mar Jacob Thoomkuzhy passes away at 94
content: His life spanned decades of tireless pastoral service, institution building, and social empowerment — especially among the struggling migrant Christian communities in Malabar. He was the first bishop of the Mananthavady diocese and later served as the archbishop of Thrissur

title: Gehlot accuses BJP of pressuring probe agencies in Rajasthan closure reports
content: Former CM cites Sanjivani scam, 2020 government-toppling case; alleges BJP shielding Shekhawat, manipulating investigations

title: Former Chief Minsiter A.K. Antony regrets the “legally unavoidable” 1995 Sivagiri police action
content: Says he had planned to elucidate on Sivagiri, Muthanga and also the Marad communal riots after the 2026 byelections to avoid ruffling feathers. However, the unilateral and undefended attacks against him in the House prompts the public response.

title: Caste system root of inequality, says Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: Education is the only tool to fight inequality and claim your rightful place in society, he says while urging oppressed communities to embrace it

title: CAG developing Large Language Model to enhance efficiency, consistency in audit analysis
content: Widely adopted digitisation at the Centre and States will soon facilitate remote or hybrid audits of most government agencies and departments

title: Welfare board for nomadic, denotified groups tells PM it needs funds, staff, permanent commission status

content: He was speaking after hoisting the National Flag and offering floral tributes to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel during the Utsav celebrations in Ballari

content: This is the fourth such hoax e-mail received at the official e-mail ID of the High Court since June this year

title: Messi sends signed World Cup jersey for PM Modi’s 75th birthday

title: Education Department told to fill 5,267 vacant teacher posts in Kalyana Karnataka, says CM

title: New study finds how calcium and pH regulate ovarian cancer spheroids
content: Dr. Tapomoy Bhattacharjee’s lab at the NCBS in collaboration with Dr. Ramray Bhat’s lab at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc.), conducted this interdisciplinary work published in the scientific journal, Small.

title: Financial irregularities found at Kerala’s Periyar Tiger Reserve
content: Financial mismanagement uncovered in recent inspection. Report reveals that PTR authorities established a Park Welfare Fund in 2004 and diverted tourism-related income into it without requisite government approval

title: India, Papua New Guinea discuss ways to further enhance bilateral ties

title: Assam unveils concert tourism policy, Post Malone to perform in Guwahati on December 8
content: After Meghalaya’s model, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma says global stars will boost Assam’s tourism and economy

content: The device has completed successful multi-location trials and is now seeking patent in the US, Europe, Japan, China and Australia.

title: High price of gold, oil reason for Kerala’s high retail inflation rate, says Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal

content: Replying to a Calling Attention motion, M.B. Rajesh says collection and processing of non-biodegradable waste in Kerala had risen from 47% in March 2023 to 98% at present

title: 2 Men Accused Of Firing At Disha Patani's House Arrested After Encounter
content: Two men accused of opening fire at the Bareilly residence of Bollywood actor Disha Patani have been arrested following a police encounter in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad, police said.

title: YouTube, New Leader Of US Media Industry, Bets On AI As Key For Creating Content
content: On its 20th birthday, YouTube is unrecognizable as the scrappy video site that began as the domain of young amateur users publishing unpolished, low-budget clips.

title: Trump Flight To London Has Close Encounter With Spirit Jet
content: A Spirit Airlines Inc. passenger jet got a little too close for comfort with a Boeing Co. 747 jumbo ferrying US President Donald Trump to London as the aircraft traveled through New York's congested skies.

title: Cops Try To Arrest Accused In Delhi Locality, Get Thrashed By His Relatives
content: Several Delhi Police personnel were injured in an attack by a group of men while attempting to arrest a person in Delhi's Fatehpur Beri area on Tuesday.

title: 'Findings Tarnished Name, Need Fresh Probe': Air India Crash Pilot's Father
content: The father of a pilot flying the Boeing Dreamliner that crashed less than a minute after take-off from Ahmedabad, has sought a proper investigation into the tragedy.

title: After CEO's Relocation Post, Karnataka Sets November Deadline To Fix Bengaluru Potholes
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has set a deadline of November for contractors to fill potholes across Bengaluru, following mounting criticism over the city's deteriorating road conditions and civic infrastructure.

title: "Good Health, Happiness...": Shashi Tharoor Wishes PM Modi On His 75th Birthday
content: Four-time Congress MP from Thiruvananthapuram, Shashi Tharoor, on Wednesday extended birthday greetings to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Thousands Of Palestinians Flee As Israeli Troops Press Forward Into Gaza City
content: Israeli troops and tanks were pushing deeper into Gaza City on Wednesday, the second day of a ground offensive that was widely condemned internationally, as Palestinians fled the devastated area en masse.

title: Missing Schoolgirl's Mutilated Body Found In Sack In Kolkata, Teacher Arrested: Cops
content: The mutilated body of a schoolgirl, who was missing for nearly a month, was found in a sack in West Bengal's Birbhum district, a senior police officer said on Wednesday.

title: 6-Year-Old Girl Crushed To Death Under Wardrobe In Gurugram: Cops
content: A six-year-old girl was killed after allegedly being crushed under a wardrobe at her home in Sohna, police said on Wednesday.

title: "Independence Gone": Ben & Jerry's Co-Founder Quits Over Row With Unilever
content: The co-founder of Ben & Jerry's has resigned from the ice cream brand after saying his company known for its social activism has lost "the independence to pursue our values" under the ownership of British giant Unilever.

title: On PM Modi's Birthday, Attempt At Blood Donation World Record Across Countries
content: A countrywide blood donation campaign was held on Wednesday as part of celebrations on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 75th birthday.

title: Farm Leader Says Deboarded From Train Over Protests, Court Junks Plea
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court disposed of a petition filed by farmer leader P Ayyakannu, who alleged repeated obstruction of his travel to New Delhi to participate in protests.

title: Pak Ex-PM Imran Khan Alleges ISI Conducting His Military Trial In Jail
content: Pakistan's jailed former prime minister Imran Khan on Wednesday alleged that he is facing a military trial in jail as it's not being conducted by a civilian judge but by an ISI officer, who takes instructions directly from Army Chief Asim Munir.

title: Indian-Origin Heart Surgeon Guilty Of Sexual Offences Gets 6 Year Jail In UK
content: An Indian-origin heart surgeon convicted of abusing his position to sexually assault female members of staff at a National Health Service (NHS) hospital in northern England has been jailed for six years.

title: Man Kills Stray Dog Near Mumbai, Gouges Out Eyeball And Plays With It
content: A man in Maharashtra killed a stray dog and was later found on the road playing with one of its eyeballs. The shocking incident took place in Mumbra, on the outskirts of Mumbai.

title: Poll Body's New Reform, Candidates' Photos On Voting Machines, Begins From Bihar
content: The Election Commission of India has made some changes to make Electronic Voting Machine ballot papers clearer and more voter-friendly.

title: 22-Year-Old Delhi Man Stabbed To Death, Minors Among 5 Detained: Cops
content: A 22-year-old call centre employee was allegedly stabbed to death by five people, including four minors, following a quarrel in southeast Delhi's Tughlakabad forest area, officials said on Wednesday.

title: 150 Categories Of Products Cheaper After GST Cut, Says Mother Dairy Chief
content: A reduction in GST rates will result in more than 150 categories of products getting cheaper from September 22, the company's Managing Director Manish Bandlish told NDTV.

title: Another Man Arrested For Sex Abuse Of Boy In Dating App Case, Total Now 10
content: The Kerala police arrested a civil contractor in connection with the ongoing investigation into the sexual assault of a 16-year-old boy, taking the total arrests in the case to 10.

title: Putin dials Modi: PM thanks 'friend'; 'India ready to help in Ukraine conflict'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, celebrating his 75th birthday, received warm greetings from Russian President Vladimir Putin. Modi thanked Putin, reaffirming India's commitment to strengthening their strategic partnership. He also expressed India's readiness to contribute to a peaceful resolution of the Ukraine conflict.

title: 'Tarnished son's reputation': Father of AI 171 pilot slams AAIB; seeks 'formal' probe
content: The father of Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, who perished in the Air India Ahmedabad crash that killed 260, is demanding a formal government inquiry, expressing distress over alleged leaks suggesting his son was suicidal. He refutes claims about his son's mental state, citing his extensive flying experience and lack of prior incidents.

title: SIR in Delhi: EC prepares for revision exercise; uploads voter list of SIR-2002
content: Delhi is preparing for a special intensive revision of electoral polls. The Election Commission has uploaded the 2002 voter list and mapped it with current constituencies. This follows a meeting with state election officials to assess preparedness. A pan-India special revision is expected soon, replacing the annual summary revision.

title: Amazon CEO’s warning: Company’s culture may be at risk; needs a reset
content: Andy Jassy, Amazon CEO, focuses on improving company culture. He aims to reduce bureaucracy and flatten the organizational structure. Amazon reintroduced a five-day work week. The company plans to increase worker-to-manager ratio. An email initiative helps employees flag unnecessary processes. Amazon laid off over 27,000 employees since 2022. AI integration may further reduce the corporate workforce in the coming years.

title: Pakistan's late drama before UAE match: Match delayed, boycott talks - what we know
content: A cloud of uncertainty looms over the Asia Cup match between Pakistan and the UAE in Dubai, leading to a delayed start amidst reports of potential forfeit. The issue stemmed from Pakistan's objection to Andy Pycroft as match referee, despite the ICC clearing him of misconduct. While the UAE team reached the venue on time, the Pakistan team's departure was initially 'stopped'.

title: 'India's growth resilient': S&P reaffirms GDP outlook despite global turbulence
content: S&P Global India Research indicates that despite global economic challenges, India's long-term economic prospects remain robust, fueled by reforms and infrastructure development. The nation is projected to maintain a 6.5% GDP growth in fiscal 2025-26, driven by domestic strengths and increasing global trade participation. India is also poised for expansion in sectors like private credit, shipbuilding, and digital infrastructure.

title: BMW crash: No bail for accused Gaganpreet; bus, ambulance also guilty, says lawyer
content: A Delhi court rejected bail for Gaganpreet Makkad, the accused in the BMW accident case involving the death of Navjot Singh. Her judicial custody is extended until September 27. Makkad's lawyer highlighted the delayed FIR and questioned the culpable homicide charge. The defense also raised concerns about a DTC bus and ambulance inaction.

title: ‘I’m disappointed with…’: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang after China sends ‘loud and clear’ message to tech companies on banning AI chips
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed disappointment over China's directive to its tech giants, including ByteDance and Alibaba, to cease purchasing Nvidia's AI chips, including the RTX Pro 6000D. This ban extends beyond previous restrictions, signaling a commitment to developing domestic AI systems. Huang acknowledged the fluctuating nature of Nvidia's China business due to ongoing US-China discussions.

title: 'Welcome those who assimilate': Trump's stark message for new US citizens
content: US president Trump will now send a congratulatory letter to all new US citizens, emphasising the "sacred bond" they form with the nation's history, culture, and values. The letter, included in the citizenship packet, reminds them of their oath and the freedoms and opportunities the US offers.

title: ‘Act of terror’: Man rams car into FBI Pittsburgh office gate; manhunt on
content: Donald Henson, a former military member, is wanted after allegedly ramming a car into the FBI's Pittsburgh field office early Wednesday. Authorities are investigating the incident as a potential act of terror. Henson reportedly crashed into the gate, placed an American flag on it, and fled on foot. A message was found scrawled on the car, which is being examined.

title: 'No interference ...': Rajnath Singh on Op Sindoor pause; big warning for Pak
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh praised the Indian Army's bravery, citing a Jaish-e-Mohammed commander's admission about the devastation caused by Operation Sindoor, which targeted Masood Azhar's family. PM Modi echoed this, highlighting the operation's success in bringing Pakistan to its knees and emphasizing India's strengthened stance against terrorism.

title: Lesson for founders: Zerodha CEO cites Nvidia chief; says success takes time
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath drew parallels between his firm's journey and Nvidia's, emphasizing the significance of timing and perseverance. Starting with a modest ₹10 lakh investment, Zerodha leveraged free infrastructure and focused on customer-centric policies like 'no spam, no tracking'. Kamath attributes Zerodha's success to being in the right place at the right time, coinciding with India's economic rise.

title: Bigger, in colour: EC's new norms for EVM ballot papers; roll-out in Bihar polls
content: The Election Commission has introduced revised guidelines for the design and printing of EVM ballot papers to improve clarity for voters, particularly in the upcoming Bihar assembly election. These changes include larger color photographs of candidates, uniform font sizes for names, and the use of pink-colored 70 GSM paper for assembly elections.

title: Usain Bolt net worth 2025: Olympic legend’s rise — business empire built
content: Usain Bolt's estimated net worth is $90 million in 2025. This reflects his athletic achievements and business ventures. Endorsements from Puma, Visa, and Gatorade contribute to his wealth. Bolt co-founded Bolt Mobility and expanded his restaurant chain. He faced financial challenges in 2023. Bolt enjoys family life in Kingston. His journey shows speed and resilience create lasting influence.

title: Cardi B pregnant: Confirms baby with Stefon Diggs; fans react
content: Popular rapper Cardi B is expecting a child with Stefon Diggs. She revealed this on CBS Mornings. The baby is due in February 2026. This is her first child with Diggs. She has three children with Offset. The couple started dating in late 2024. They were seen together at a Knicks game.

title: Lodha Developers 'fraud' case: Crime branch arrests ex-director Rajendra N Lodha
content: Mumbai's crime branch has apprehended Rajendra N. Lodha, along with accomplices, for allegedly defrauding Lodha Developers of Rs 85 crore. The real estate firm accused its former director, Rajendra Narpatmal Lodha, his son, and associates of fraud, misappropriation, and criminal breach of trust. Rajendra Lodha is accused of unauthorized property sales, undervaluing land deals, and illegal TDR transactions.

title: Bahrain visa for Indians: On-arrival access, application tips, and entry rules
content: Indian citizens visiting Bahrain can obtain a visa on arrival for short stays, provided they meet basic entry requirements. Alternatively, travellers may apply online in advance by submitting necessary documents. This guide explains eligibility criteria, required paperwork, step-by-step application procedures, and arrival protocols at Bahrain International Airport, helping ensure a smooth and well-prepared travel experience.

title: 'SpaceX' cocaine: Oz pilot dies in plane crash; cops find 200kg of drugs
content: A plane crashed in Brazil, revealing a shocking discovery. Authorities found approximately 200 kg of cocaine concealed in SpaceX-labeled packaging. The Australian pilot, Timothy J. Clark, was found dead at the crash site. The plane, registered in Zambia, had extra fuel tanks. Police are investigating the drug trafficking operation and the pilot's knowledge of Brazilian air routes.

title: Destiny banned from Twitch: Elon Musk, conservatives blamed; income wiped out
content: Political streamer Destiny, Steven Bonnell II, faces a Twitch ban he attributes to a coordinated effort by Elon Musk and conservatives, alleging it's free speech issues following controversial comments on Charlie Kirk. Destiny claims his income is eliminated due to the ban, triggered by 'Hateful Conduct' accusations related to discrimination.

title: 'Navalny poisoned': Wife says labs reveal foul play; claims Putin responsible
content: Yulia Navalnaya, wife of Alexei Navalny, alleges that independent lab tests confirm he was poisoned while in prison. Navalny, a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin, died in February 2024. The labs, located in two countries, concluded that Navalny was killed by poisoning. Navalny previously survived a poisoning attempt in 2020.

title: SBI branch looted: Gang barges in, ties up staff, flees with Rs 20 crore haul
content: In a brazen heist, three masked men robbed a State Bank of India branch in Vijayapura, Karnataka, making off with over Rs 21 crore in cash and gold. Armed with country-made pistols and knives, the suspects tied up the bank staff before fleeing in a Suzuki EVA with a fake number plate.

title: Pakistan vs UAE in doubt? ACC social media post creates further chaos
content: Tensions escalate within the Pakistan camp ahead of their crucial Asia Cup match against UAE, as the ACC unexpectedly deleted its social media post promoting the game, raising concerns about Pakistan's participation.

title: 'Brain-eating amoeba' claims 19 lives in Kerala
content: Kerala is on high alert following 19 deaths from Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM) this year, with 69 cases reported. While no clusters are linked to single water sources like in 2024, health officials have heightened surveillance after the Nipah outbreak. Authorities are urging chlorination and testing, but treatment remains challenging due to limited options.

title: 'Our soldiers brought Pak to its knees': PM Modi reacts to JeM commander's video; hails Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Modi, celebrating his 75th birthday in Madhya Pradesh, lauded Operation Sindoor's success, citing a Jaish-e-Muhammed commander's video confession. The commander admitted the operation devastated Maulana Masood Azhar's family and JeM's Bahawalpur headquarters on May 7. Modi asserted that this "new India" fears no threats and strikes within enemy territory, prioritizing national security after Pakistani terrorists harmed Indian citizens.

title: BJ Penn Arrested: UFC icon faces charges in Hawaii
content: UFC legend BJ Penn faces renewed legal troubles after his recent arrest in Hawai'i for allegedly violating a protective order. This incident, occurring on September 15, marks another entry in a series of concerning run-ins with the law. Penn's arrest also raises questions about his well-being and how it overshadows his celebrated MMA career

title: Sebi leases Rs 7 lakh/month luxury flat for chairman - check details here
content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has leased a luxurious five-bedroom apartment in Mumbai's Prabhadevi for its chairman, Tuhin Kanta Pandey, at a monthly rent of Rs 7 lakh. The three-year lease includes a 3,000 sq. ft. apartment with four car parks and a 5% annual rent escalation, aligning with Sebi's policy for leased accommodations.

title: The void between India and Pakistan is not just in skills, but also the way they train
content: Watching India and Pakistan train in Dubai highlighted the gulf between the two sides. India’s discipline, punctuality and structured sessions contrasted starkly with Pakistan’s disorganised approach. While Indian batters endured rigorous drills under coaches, Pakistan turned to casual football and trial-and-error practice — mirroring their struggles on the field.

title: 'Priyanka Chopra had bad skin, she is big-boned': Prahlad Kakkar lauds actress
content: Priyanka Chopra's journey from a pageant winner to a Bollywood star and then to Hollywood is lauded by adman Prahlad Kakkar. He reveals that she overcame disadvantages like her complexion and build with hard work and determination. Kakkar praises her ambition, focus, and dignity, especially regarding her personal life, highlighting her resilience in restarting her career in a new industry.

title: ‘Come to Vizag’: Andhra IT minister Nara Lokesh invites BlackBuck CEO Rajesh Yabaji
content: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh extended an invitation to BlackBuck's CEO Rajesh Yabaji to relocate the company to Visakhapatnam, following Yabaji's announcement of leaving Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road due to severe commuting issues. This move has ignited concerns within Bengaluru's IT sector regarding governance and infrastructure, prompting calls for government intervention to address deteriorating road conditions and public utilities.

title: PM Modi turns 75: Trump dials 'friend', Meloni posts selfie; wishes pour in
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated his 75th birthday with global leaders extending their heartfelt wishes, acknowledging his leadership and India's growing global influence. US President Donald Trump, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, and New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon lauded PM Modi's friendship and vision. Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also conveyed their greetings, emphasising strong bilateral ties.

title: 'Why you asking for my wife's number': Foreign tourist confronts man in Amritsar - watch
content: A video from Amritsar shows a foreign tourist confronting a local man for inappropriately asking his wife for her phone number. The tourist questioned the man's behavior, deeming it "strange." Social media users expressed frustration, sharing similar experiences of harassment faced by women in India. One user recounted incidents of strangers incessantly requesting photos with his girlfriend.

title: 'Decided not to play': How Vaishali's Chennai nightmare helped her win Grand Swiss
content: Grandmaster R Vaishali secured her spot in the Women’s Candidates Tournament 2026 by winning the Women’s Grand Swiss in Samarkand. This victory came after a challenging experience at the Chennai Grand Masters, where she faced a series of losses. Ironically, her lowered rating from the Chennai tournament inadvertently contributed to her Grand Swiss win due to tie-break calculations.

title: GST rate cuts: FM says reforms to inject Rs 2L cr; claims 'people will have cash in hand'
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that GST rate cuts, effective September 22, are expected to inject Rs 2 lakh crore into the economy. Post-reform, most items have shifted to lower tax brackets. Companies are reportedly reducing rates, passing benefits to consumers.

title: 'Not a fan': Dana White makes blunt confession about WWE
content: UFC President Dana White reiterated his disinterest in WWE in 2025. He acknowledged the athleticism of WWE performers, praising Logan Paul. White emphasized the difference between UFC's real combat and WWE's scripted entertainment. He recalled his disagreement with Lawrence Epstein's crossover fan idea from 2023. White maintains his focus remains solely on the fight game.

title: ‘Severe pain’: India’s exports to US fall drastically on Trump’s 50% tariffs; check details
content: India's exports to the US have been declining for three consecutive months, with August experiencing a significant 16.3% drop due to increased tariffs imposed by the US. The impact is uneven, heavily affecting sectors like apparel and gems, potentially leading to substantial export losses and job cuts.

title: Hands tied, lashed with leather belt, kicked: Andhra woman tortured by husband
content: Andhra Pradesh police are searching for Balraju, who is accused of tying his first wife, Bhagyamma, to a pole and assaulting her in Prakasam district on September 13. The incident stemmed from Balraju's suspicion of infidelity and Bhagyamma's refusal to provide money for his medical treatment, as she is the sole caretaker of their four children.

title: Asia Cup handshake row: AAP slams Suryakumar Yadav, BCCI
content: The Aam Aadmi Party has escalated the India-Pakistan handshake controversy, with leader Saurabh Bharadwaj challenging Suryakumar Yadav and the BCCI. Bharadwaj urged them to donate match earnings to the Pahalgam terror attack victims' widows.

title: 'Action will be taken': IPL chairman on PCB's complaint; clarifies ICC will review
content: Following a handshake controversy during the Asia Cup clash, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) lodged a complaint against match referee Andy Pycroft, requesting his removal. While the ICC rejected the initial appeal, Pycroft has been "rested" for Pakistan's upcoming match.

title: 'Woh toh dabayenge na': Dhanashree Verma reacts to rumours of cheating Chahal
content: Dhanashree Verma, following her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, addresses rumors of infidelity on the reality show 'Rise And Fall.' She dismisses divorce gossip as fabricated and hints at revealing her side of the story, suggesting Chahal fears her speaking out. Dhanashree also declares she's currently uninterested in finding love, humorously comparing herself to Salman Khan.

content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the news cycle will constantly affect player values when viewed from a fantasy baseball perspective . 'make your picks Yordan Alvarez sprained his left ankle on Monday .

title: Indiana-Illinois and under-the-radar games in the College Football Playoff hunt
content: two teams are set to meet in front of a sold-out crowd . one team made the college football Playoff in 2024 . the other won 10 games last season, finished no. 16 in AP poll . both coaches have won championships and individual awards .

title: WNBA championship, series odds: Lynx, Aces current title faves
content: the Minnesota Lynx enter the WNBA playoffs as the favorite to win the fifth championship in franchise history . the team's 16-game win streak to end the regular season is the longest in four years, according to ESPN Research . star A'ja Wilson wrapped up her second consecutive scoring title, after the Storm won Tuesday night .

title: Burning questions for all 32 NHL teams: John Gibson's impact in Detroit, a Sidney Crosby trade?
content: the 2025 NHL draft was decentralized, but there was no shortage of memorable moments and celebrity cameos . a chill enters the air, the leaves start to change color and pumpkin-themed items appear on food and drink menu . how to watch the NHL season on ESPN networks -- including 100 exclusive games .

title: Wrestlepalooza 2025: Date, time, channel, card, how to watch
content: the deal includes two-night events, such as WrestleMania and SummerSlam, plus other WWE premium live events . the event will mark the first premium live event (PLE) from WWE on ESPN in September .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Seattle, Indiana pull even, force series to Game 3
content: the WNBA playoffs are underway, but no team is going quietly . both the Seattle Storm and the Indiana Fever won to force their series to a decisive Game 3 . the longest winning streak in the series came to an end after a 14-point deficit .
